channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A board game born in Mexican prisons is bringing together people from all walks of life
Biden commutes sentences of 37 of 40 federal death row inmates
item.description: President Biden is granting clemency to 37 of the 40 federal inmates facing death sentences​. Their sentences will be commuted to life in prison witho...

item.title: Gaetz ethics report says his drug use, sex with a minor violated state laws
item.description: A report by the House Ethics Committee found former Rep. Matt Gaetz paid multiple women, including a 17-year-old girl, for sex.

item.title: Kremlin denies Assad’s British wife wants to divorce him and return to UK
Many Americans have come to rely on Chinese-made drones. Now lawmakers want to ban them
item.description: The economic and technological rivalry between the U.S. and China has come to the drone market, where Chinese-made flying devices are a dominant playe...

item.title: What's in the approved government funding bill
item.description: After days of heated negotiations on Capitol Hill, the House passed its funding bill to prevent a government shutdown Friday night.

item.title: Biden commutes sentences of nearly all federal death row inmates
item.description: The move reduces the sentence for all but three of the 40 inmates on federal death row.

item.title: Honda and Nissan announce plans to merge
item.description: Honda and Nissan have announced plans to merge, forming world's third-largest automaker by sales as the industry transitions away from fossil fuels.

item.title: WATCH: Meet the moms who shred the half-pipe
item.description: ABC News’ Danny New visits a group of mothers who are finding joy and catching air at a skatepark in Brooklyn, New York.

item.title: Are you contagious? Here's when you're most likely to spread COVID, flu, RSV
item.description: How long are you contagious after getting COVID, flu, RSV, pneumonia and more? Here's what to know to keep others safe this holiday season.

item.title: Middle East live updates: Israel to act against Houthis in Yemen, Netanyahu says
item.description: Rebel forces in Syria are building a transitional government after toppling the regime of President Bashar Assad in a lightning-quick advance across t...

item.title: Starbucks strike expands to 3 more cities ahead of Christmas
item.description: The Workers United union strike is in its third of five planned days amid a busy holiday season for Starbucks.

item.title: The new right celebrates Trump at a conservative conference and sidesteps inconsistencies
Abortion opponents shift focus to pills with lawsuits, proposed laws and possible federal action
All 10 passengers killed after small plane crashes into house in southern Brazil
South Korea says it detects signs of North Korea preparing more troops, drones for Russia
China says it provided information, documents in Baltic Sea cables inquiry
Health care AI, intended to save money, requires expensive humans
item.description: Despite the hype over artificial intelligence in medicine, the systems require consistent monitoring and staffing to put in place and maintain.
